intro: Cacalia zollingerianodes, commonly known as the Zollinger's cacalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically showy blooms. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy in texture. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense, daisy-like cluster, making it visually appealing. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open grasslands and rocky habitats.
